comment: This class was pretty easy. There are one questions quizzes on every chapter of the book (which are generally super easy to find the answer to). The tests were directly from the book and went in order of the chapters, so they were fairly easy to find the answers to. Watch out for some of the confusing deadlines as they were often outdated.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: One of the worst instructors I've ever had. Regularly got information wrong in the lectures and test questions. Slow to grade, and I think he didn't actually read the papers when grading, so you don't get constructive feedback. Not very well-spoken or articulate, but makes you listen to his video lectures - no text/PPT notes available.
rating_tags: SO MANY PAPERS--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Easy class, one response paper a week about a topic he gives. Two tests. Very very veryyyy slow grader he hasnt graded assignments from A month ago yet. Group project is annoying, its an online class dont think a group project is necessary. Chill easy guy though

Great class, super easy. He warns you that the class is hard, but it really isn't. He gives 1 paper a week that is 1-2 pages over the chapter, but he does a video lecture each week and basically tells you what to say. He gives you list of TEST QUESTIONS! So you basically can complete all the short answer questions and copy and paste them.

Online Class, but unlike any online class Ive taken so far. 2 random discussion posts, 1 weekly reading assignment, no word limit on your paper, you just have to make sure he knows you read and understood what he assigned. One group assignment and 2 tests. Easy grader. Great professor. 100% recommend taking his class!

I've taken him for 3300, and he was better than this semester. He takes FOREVER to grade. 5 discussions, 5 journals, midterm, final and project. He often forgets to update paperwork with the correct dates too. The only good thing is that on more heavily weighted items (exams, project which in total count for 70%), he seems to be very lenient.

I took the online Social Problems with Mr. Irvin, and I would definitely take another one of his classes. Read the text and keep up with the assignments and due dates, you'll do well.  I liked the fact that Mr. Irvin laid out all of the assignments at the beginning (some of my past professors did not) which made it easy to be prepared.
Sociology of Religion. Very easy class online. Weekly reading and one weekly assignment (extremely easy). Midterm and Final. Honestly, you'd have to just not do any work to fail this class.

I took Foundation of Social Theory on-line. Mr. Irvin loves this course. He post You-tubes Videos that are awesome and helpful. Please read, participate in all your discussion post and take good notes. I learned a lot and Mr. Irvin is a fair professor.

I took him for Foundations of Social Theory, this class was tougher than I expected but not too difficult. For the online course, it was basically a discussion post every week and two tests. Make certain you read the text because you are graded by your content in the discussion posts. Just be accurate and respond to other people's posts as well.

Take him if you can. I learned so many different things in this class and it was easy for the most part.The syllabus is not as clear as it should be, and sometimes he's bad with responding to emails in a timely manner, but that's about it.

Took him for Soci of religion. He was just ok. The book we used was so old that I feel it wasnt that valid. We didnt really talk about other religions much which I didnt like. I dont think I really got what the class was about. The exams were tough, make sure you really read the material. I probably would not take him again.
